meanings.definition: To care for a child or children as a babysitter.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I babysat my neighbor's kids while she went to work.
meanings.sent2: She often babysat her younger siblings when her parents were busy.
meanings.sent3: The cat babysat the kittens while the mother cat went out to hunt.
meanings.sent4: The sun babysat the earth, providing warmth and light for all living creatures.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the time I babysat a mischievous toddler who loved playing hide-and-seek.
